text:
Hi, I’m Jessica Felicia, a Business Analytics Master’s student at UCI Paul Merage School of Business. I specialize in Data and Marketing Analytics, and I love using data to improve customer experiences, optimize strategies, and inform business decisions.

title: Clustering Analysis (Sun County Airlines)
text: The purpose of this project is to assist Sun Country Airlines in maximizing the use of its customer data to more effectively inform the marketing and product development teams so that the small airliner can better navigate the competitive airline industry. As a small airliner, the company needs to have a deep understanding of its customer segments, habits, and demographics to avoid poaching from larger airlines.

title: About Me
text:
<img src="/workspaces/jessicafeliciaa.github.io/projects/images/jessica.JPG" alt="Jessica Felicia" style="max-width: 100%; border-radius: 16px; box-shadow: 0 4px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);">



M.S. in Business Analytics
Paul Merage School of Business - University of California, Irvine
I’m a Master’s student at the Paul Merage School of Business, specializing in Business Analytics. I have a strong passion for leveraging data to uncover insights and drive strategic decisions, especially in the areas of marketing analytics, customer segmentation, and business intelligence.
My work blends technical skills in Python, SQL, Tableau, and Excel with a business-first mindset. I’ve led and contributed to projects involving churn rate analysis, recommendation systems, Yelp analysis, Customer segmentation analysis.
I’m particularly drawn to problems where human behavior meets data, and I thrive in collaborative settings where I can turn messy datasets into meaningful insights for stakeholders.

title: About
text: I’m a Master Student majoring in Business Analytics at Paul Merage School of Business, Irvine.

title: About Me
text:
🎯 Goals & Mindset
As an aspiring data-driven professional, I’m always learning and eager to work on impactful projects that connect analytics to business value. Whether it’s optimizing customer journeys, exploring behavior through clustering, or crafting dashboards for decision-makers, I aim to bring clarity through data.
Let’s connect and create something meaningful together!

title: Sun County Airlines – Customer Segmentation
text:
Sun County Airlines, a small U.S.-based carrier, faces pressure from larger competitors. To compete effectively, the company needs a deep understanding of its customers’ behavior, demographics, and travel preferences. This project uses unsupervised machine learning to segment customers into distinct groups for targeted marketing and product development.





Combine and clean customer datasets from Excel
Identify key features relevant to customer behavior
Apply clustering to uncover unique customer groups
Provide insights for strategic marketing decisions





We used two spreadsheets from Sun County Airlines containing customer booking and demographic data. After merging the data using Pandas in Google Colab, we selected the following variables:

Birthdate (Age)
Booking Class & Channel
Base Fare Paid
Membership Status
Product Type
Route Details
Group Size
Booking Lead Time (days_pre_booked)
Seasonality Habits





We used K-means clustering after standardizing numerical features and encoding categorical ones. The Elbow method suggested that k = 5 was optimal.



Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn)
Google Colab
Matplotlib & Seaborn
Excel (raw input files)








Most frequently fly solo or in pairs, book standard class, and fly year-round.





• Boost Visibility on Travel Platforms: Partner with OTAs and meta-search engines (e.g., Expedia, Skyscanner) to secure premium listings and improve flight discoverability.
• Manage Reviews Proactively: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews and respond to feedback to build trust and reputation.
• Offer Destination Bundles: Create travel packages for popular routes (e.g., BOS, DFW, LAX) by bundling flights with hotels or car rentals to attract deal-seeking travelers.




Group travelers, often younger, travel mainly during spring with discounted fares.





• Promote Spring Travel Deals: Offer group discounts, family packages, and senior travel incentives to appeal to larger group travelers.
• Bundle Group Packages: Partner with tour providers for all-inclusive deals that combine flights, hotels, and activities, optimized for multi-passenger bookings.
• Highlight Senior-Friendly Services: Emphasize amenities like priority boarding, wheelchair assistance, and personalized service.
• Drive Ufly Program Adoption: Incentivize loyalty signups with group booking bonuses, Q1 travel discounts, and senior-exclusive perks.




Youngest cluster, budget-conscious, often use mobile booking channels.






Frequent early months flights, loyal customers from Minneapolis hub.






Wide age range, price-driven, high sensitivity to sales and promotions.
